intro: Frangula longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled buckthorn, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dark berries that are typically consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. Frangula longistyla is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic flora.
